channel.title: What VPS Hoster Would Suit my Needs Best?
channel.description:
I plan on releasing my server soon. There's two developer's, me and my friend. Our goal is 20 online at a time by the end of the month. This is achievable since we've both run servers before and have friends piling up on our Skype accounts asking to play. On launch day, we expect at least 5 players at a time. We'll probably always be connected to the VPS in some way, shape, or form. We also, cant use Linux. No matter how hard I tried to get my friend aquanited with it, it just didn't work.
So, here's what we need.
A VPS that can hold a relatively stable source 24/7 with 20 players. Can't be Linux. Won't Blacklist IP's if they're not the ones used during registration. (I've had this happen, and I had to submit tickets. :/)
Well, I guess it could be Linux if it's a desktop edition, my friend couldn't understand how command lines work.... (facepalm)
PS: We're on a budget. A ramen noodle every night budget. Don't link me to a site that'll charge us $60 a month for a cheap VPS.

item.title: What VPS Hoster Would Suit my Needs Best?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“enzo42, post:4, topic:525736”]burst.net seems cheap, $12.95 for 1GB ram and 1.5GHz processor (windows vps)[/quote]Yeah, Lazerhosting has a 1.5Ghz Dedicated CPU, 1024 MB DDR3 RAM Win-VPS for $15/mo.

Read full topic
item.source: What VPS Hoster Would Suit my Needs Best?

item.title: What VPS Hoster Would Suit my Needs Best?
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:2, topic:525736”]racksteady[/quote]No thank you.

I would recommend Lazerhosting, they’ve got some pretty cheap ones. They also sell dedicated servers for decent quality VPS-price.

Read full topic
item.source: What VPS Hoster Would Suit my Needs Best?
